DefinitionAliases.DefinitionAlias:
Critical Face indicates where this specific feature is applied to according to the predefined enumeration type AISC_EM11_CriticalFace. Value should use one of enumerated value:
  • Front
  • Top
  • Bottom
  • Behind
  • Left
  • Right

Fabrication Methods of the applied feature can have multiple values if needed. Possible values are predefined in AISC_EM11_FabricationMethod enumerated type.
  • Punching
  • Sub-PunchingAndReaming
  • Drilling
  • HoleSawing
  • FlamePiercingAndReaming
  • FlameCutting
  • Milling
  • FaceMachining
  • Planing
  • Grinding
  • Sawing
  • FrictionSawing
  • ColdSawing
  • Oxygen-AcetyleneFlameCutting
  • PlasmaCutting
  • LaserCutting
  • Shearing
Describes special treatment, such as rounded rectangle

PsetDefinitionAliases.PsetDefinitionAlias: Features modify the shape and appearance of the associated host element. Features in EM11 are further specialized based on its type. Features are Bolt Hole, Slot Hole, Opening, Cope, and Skewed End. A Feature has their own geometry representation and subtract its geometry from the shape of the master element through Voids Element (IfcRelVoidsElement). Features should not and cannot directly manipulate geometry of the host element using Boolean Operation (IfcBooleanResult) or Boundary Representation.
